a.name: Archery Range
a.info: Used to train and upgrade archer units.

b.name: Barracks
b.info: Used to train and upgrade infantry units.

c.name: Caravanserai
c.info: Economic building. Heals and increases speed of Trade Carts in a 10 tile radius. Unique building of the Hindustanis.

d.name: Dock
d.info: Used to build and upgrade ships, deposit food from Fishing Ships, and trade with other players by sea.

d2.name: Harbor
d2.info: Used to build and upgrade ships, deposit food from Fishing Ships, and trade with other players by sea. Unique building of the Malay. Automatically attacks enemies within range.

e.name: House
e.info: Provides 5 population each. Your current/supportable population is shown at the top of the screen.

f.name: Farm
f.info: Renewable food source. Provides a limited amount of food before it goes fallow and must be rebuilt. Only one Villager may work a Farm at a time. You can farm abandoned enemy Farms.

g.name: Mining Camp
g.info: Used to deposit stone and gold and research mining technologies. Build near stone or gold mines to gather these resources faster.

h.name: Town Center
h.info: Used to train Villagers, deposit resources, advance to the next Age, and research technologies. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers provide additional projectiles. Provides 5 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

i.name: Mill
i.info: Used to deposit food and research farming technologies. Build near forage bushes or other source of food to gather food faster.

i2.name: Folwark
i2.info: Unique building of the Poles. Used to deposit food and research farming technologies. Immediately collects 10% of food from nearby newly constructed farms. Provides 5 population. Build near forage bushes or other source of food to gather food faster.

j.name: Bombard Tower
j.info: Gunpowder tower with a powerful ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Strong vs. ships.

k.name: Siege Workshop
k.info: Used to build and upgrade siege weapons.

l.name: Stable
l.info: Used to train and upgrade cavalry units.

m.name: Market
m.info: Used to buy and sell resources, trade with other players by land, and research trade technologies. Required to send resources to other players. Enables you to see the line of sight of your allies.

n.name: Donjon
n.info: Fortification used to train your unique unit. Unique building of the Sicilians. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers shoot additional projectiles.

o.name: Outpost
o.info: Watch tower with great line-of-sight to discover nearby enemy activity. Does not attack and cannot garrison units inside.

p.name: Palisade Wall
p.info: Wooden wall that is cheap and easy to build. Slows down your enemies and warns you of their approach. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

pg.name: Palisade Gate
pg.info: Can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

q.name: Fish Trap
q.info: Renewable food source, similar to a farm but built by Fishing Ships. Provides a limited amount of food before it collapses and must be rebuilt. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

r.name: Feitoria
r.info: Economic building. Generates resources without the need for villagers. Unique building of the Portuguese. Requires 20 population.

s.name: Blacksmith
s.info: Used to research technologies to improve armor and attack of units.

t.name: Krepost
t.info: Fortification used to train your unique unit. Unique building of the Bulgarians. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Provides 20 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

t1.name: Watch Tower
t1.info: Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. archers. Weak vs.units at close range, especially Rams.

t2.name: Guard Tower
t2.info: Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. archers. Weak vs.units at close range, especially Rams.

t3.name: Keep
t3.info: Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. archers. Weak vs.units at close range, especially Rams.

u.name: University
u.info: Used to research technologies to improve units and buildings.

v.name: Castle
v.info: Used to train and upgrade your unique unit, build Trebuchets, and research technologies. Automatically attacks enemies within range. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Units and Villagers provide additional projectiles. Provides 20 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

w1.name: Stone Wall
w1.info: Stone wall that is difficult to breach without siege weapons. Slows down your enemies and warns you of their approach. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

w2.name: Fortified Wall
w2.info: Stone wall that is difficult to breach without siege weapons. Slows down your enemies and warns you of their approach. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

wg.name: Gate
wg.info: Can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

x.name: Wonder
x.info: A Wonder of the World that demonstrates the superiority of your civilization. Constructing a Wonder that stands for a certain period of time is one way to win the game. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

y.name: Monastery
y.info: Used to train and upgrade Monks. Garrison relics to generate gold. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.

z.name: Lumber Camp
z.info: Used to deposit wood and research wood-gathering technologies. Build near forests to gather wood faster.
